Where do the candidates stand on civil rights?
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
ACLU: Nearly 1,000 More Children Separated at the Border
 
Almost 1,000 additional parents and children have been separated at the border since the court blocked family separations over a year ago. That's because the government is manufacturing reasons to keep separating families – using a parent's history of traffic violations, shoplifting, or other shockingly minor offenses to justify kidnapping their children. Read more

(This link brings you to a third-party website, cbsnews.com)


FROM THE FRONT LINES

 
We're Suing Missouri to Stop the 8-week Abortion Ban
 
ACLU and Planned Parenthood have joined forces to take Missouri to court. The cruel new law, set to take effect at the end of August, bans all abortions after just eight weeks of pregnancy, with no exceptions for victims of rape or incest. We're challenging all the new so-called "heartbeat" bans in court, and have been winning injunctions to stop them from going into effect. Read more

(This link brings you to a third-party website, cbsnews.com)


Legal Victory for Transgender People in North Carolina
 
A federal court stopped a pair of new state laws designed to keep trans people out of public restrooms. The lead plaintiff explains: "Being able to use facilities that match our gender is a basic necessity for participating in public life and being treated as full members of society. It is not a luxury." Read more


Oklahoma: Black Crime Victims Denied Victims Comp More Often than Whites
 
Like many states, Oklahoma offers financial assistance to families dealing with the loss or injury of a loved one due to violent crime. Black families, however, get turned down for this funding more often than their white counterparts despite being two and a half times more likely to be victims of violent crime. The ACLU Analytics team crunched numbers to show the staggering racial disparity in victims compensation. Read more


Crystal Mason Sentenced to 5 Years for Casting a Provisional Ballot
 
Crystal was arrested and sentenced to five years in prison for casting a provisional ballor in the 2016 election. She didn't realize that being on supervised release meant that she was not eligible to vote in federal elections. Her probation officer even admitted at her trial that he had never informed her. Read more






TUNE IN

 
At Liberty Podcast: The Fight for Police Accountability
When the Justice Department declined to press charges against the NYPD officer who took Eric Garner's life, it shed new light on a sad fact: Most police officers implicated in civilian deaths escape punishment. One of our senior staff attorneys explains the obstacles to holding the police accountable, and how we can reform the system. Listen to the latest episode here.






WHAT'S NEXT?

 
The Fight Against Trump's Border Wall Continues
Recently the Supreme Court gave the President a temporary greenlight to begin border wall construction – but it's not the "big victory" he declared. The order is limited to specific projects where fencing already exists. More importantly, the Court has not yet decided the case we filed on behalf of the Sierra Club and SBCC, and the Trump administration is facing a much higher bar that it has previously failed to meet. Read more






TAKE ACTION

 
Speak Up: Support Trans Student Athletes
Transgender student athletes have the right to participate in school sports consistent with their gender identity. Denying this right is blatant discrimination. Sign the pledge to stand with all transgender people and their right to live as their authentic selves. Take action
